alert.note: Alert for Adjuntas; Jayuya; Lares; Utuado (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 18 at 3:06PM ADT until September 18 at 7:30PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Adjuntas County in Puerto Rico... Jayuya County in Puerto Rico... Lares County in Puerto Rico... Utuado County in Puerto Rico... * Until 630 PM AST. * At 206 PM AST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 6 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms and heavy rains producing flash flooding. Quick rives along rivers and streams. Mudslides and rockfall in areas of steep terrain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of rivers,creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Jayuya, Adjuntas, Utuado, Lares and Cayuco. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
